data.title: Turncoat remains wedded to his prenuptial Bill
data.meta_description: Life is cruel and, in some special cases, this seems exactly right. This is what I thought yesterday when the Tory turncoat who is Quentin Davies arose to present his prenuptial agreements Bill. The
data.text:
Life is cruel and, in some special cases, this seems exactly right. This is what I thought yesterday when the Tory turncoat who is Quentin Davies arose to present his prenuptial agreements Bill. The situation was ridiculous in so many ways that it was hard to keep track. Here was a ludicrous man making a ludicrous argument for a ten-minute rule Bill that stands no chance of becoming law. Welcome to the Democracy Madhouse.

The timing could not have been worse or, from my point of view, better. The Commons had just been treated to an hour-long disquisition from the new Prime Minister about the importance of strengthening Parliament. Gordon Brown loves democracy and Parliament. Most of all, he loves giving statements about how much
